title: Sanditon finale slammed: Jane Austen would be 'turning in her grave'
text:
Charlotte (Rose Williams) did not get a happy ending in the Sanditon finale (Picture: PA)

Sanditon fans were furious with the ending of the ITV drama last night, claiming Jane Austen would have been ‘turning in her grave’.

The series was lifted from the unfinished works of the Pride and Prejudice author, and saw star-crossed lovers Charlotte (Rose Williams) and Sidney (Theo James) separated by a cruel twist of fate.

Austen was famous for her happy endings, and the brutal blow last night just didn’t feel very ‘Austen’.

Jane Austen right now after watching how they ended #sandition pic.twitter.com/OM8JsD1WIW — Rachel Dunn McGlynn (@McglynnDunn) October 13, 2019

I would to thank @ITV for tagging us along for the last eight weeks and leaving us with an ending that Jane Austen would have been stunned by. #Sandition — Chloe (@Loopylouspurs) October 13, 2019

Advertisement

Advertisement

But the cliffhanger was undeniably heartbreaking. Charlotte and Sidney finally shared a kiss after eight weeks of slow-burning, but things ended in disaster after Sidney returned to London to marry his rich old flame in an effort to save Sanditon itself.

For some viewers, however, the sad finale only made them want a second series of the period drama even more.

That's all we're getting?! Nah if we don't get a season 2 I'm writing to ofcom #Sandition — Ane (@AnesJournal) October 13, 2019

Well that ending was disappointing after last week 😣 there's got to be an another series or what was the point 😡 #sandition pic.twitter.com/k2guTHwosI — Maxine 💜 Winchesters 👑 J3 👨‍👦‍👦 (@spnmax) October 13, 2019

The series comes from writer Andrew Davies, who famously adapted Pride and Prejudice for TV in the 90s, with Colin Firth as Mr Darcy. That, of course, famously ended with Elizabeth Bennet defying the odds and marrying Darcy, which Sanditon viewers definitely did not get…

Well, let’s all hope we get a second instalment with a happier ending, yes?

Sanditon is available to watch now on the ITV Hub.
